result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A Selph

records.addlTxt:
11:02am Court in session

Defendant Michael Selph present in court with attorney Mackenzie Renner. ADA Andrew Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense has filed 2 motions

Response argument by ADA Herrmann as to disclosure of CI motion
Discussion between Court & State as to purpose of this hearing 
Further argument by ADA Herrmann

Deft is aware that all offers will be revoked 

Court is granting the motion to disclose as well as any exculpatory evidence

Motion to amend bond regarding 3rd party contact, State is not objecting

Court grants bond motion

Court will set trial dates & extends time limits

Cases are back to back at this time

If a status is needed, parties to notify the court

11:09am Court in recess
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 24, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael A Selph in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Michael A Selph.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Michael A Selph in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Michael A Selph.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:26 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 1st status on both files - 21CF676 and 22CF200. Record by Atty. Renner who asks for additional status. Court grants request. Matter scheduled before assigned judge - Koss. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Prosecuting attorney James Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael A Selph in court.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Michael A Selph. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt:
2:17 PM Defendant Michael A Selph in court.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tony Kim in court for Michael A Selph. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over.

records.addlTxt: Tony Kim
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

Defendant Michael A Selph appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Tony Kim..  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Attorney Sempf. Called @ 2:16 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance on 22CF200 and adjourned initial appearance on 21CF676. Record by Atty. Kim who goes over the charges in the new complaint with the defendant. Atty. Kim asks that both matters be set for preliminary hearing within time limits. Court sets as requested..
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Letter to Judge in regards to bond money posted
"Yes, she is entitled to have her bond back once defendant is remanded in custody." PAK
Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice of Arrest
Order to seal notice of arrest

Viven TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael Andnell Selph in court, in custody by video with Attorney Leah Selmek. Defendant does qualify for SPD attorney. Court would consider co-signer if one is able to appear in court. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

AMENDMENT 10/19/2022: COURT LIFTS NO CONTACT WITH DANIELLE M. PALMA

BOND TO COVER 22GF317 & 21CF676
MUST COMPLY WITH PRETRIAL SERVICES.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH CO-ACTOR DANIELLE M. PALMA. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-1574 & 22-1575
336 Bradley Ave, Delavan WI 53115
In Support of Search Warrant
